channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024051572
item.description:
Report X-2024051572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered. Packaged inside of the fiberboard box were plastic barrier bags containing UN2922 with air bags for dunnage. Of the the barrier bags was damaged causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024051251
item.description:
Report X-2024051251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-06T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/18/2024 at approximately 0530, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 355827 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a gasoline spill. The shipment consisted by 2 glass bottles packaged in a fiberboard box. The spill was due to complete leakage of both bottles, resulting in total loss. The cause of the spillage is unknown. The shipment is being disposed of as hazardous waste.

item.title: Report E-2024050721
item.description:
Report E-2024050721

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 28, 2024, sixteen (16) 1-gallon pails and twelve (12) 1-pint cans of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted trailer to the extent practicable. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024051373
item.description:
Report X-2024051373

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A multi piece shipment was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. During the spill agents investigation they discovered that all four of the packaged in the shipment had a release. Each package was a fiberboard box with a drum inside the drum was inside of a plastic bag. All of the drums were leaking from the cap. They were placed into steel salvage packages and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024051372
item.description:
Report X-2024051372

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans and one of them had a damaged bottom chime causing the release. The cans were packaged with fiberboard dividers and paper for dunnage. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024051264
item.description:
Report X-2024051264

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiber board box was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained a small metal drum. It was packaged with absorbent pads inside of a plastic bag. The bottom chime was damaged causing the release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
